00030 //: Define default values
00031 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::set_defaults()
00032 {
00033   step_size_=1.0;
00034   search_ni_=5;
00035   search_nj_=5;
00036   nA_=0; dA_=0.0;
00037   ns_=0; ds_=1.0;
00038   ref_x_ = 0.0;
00039   ref_y_ = 0.0;
00040   overlap_f_=1.0;
00041 }

00051 //: Define filter kernel to search with
00052 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::set(const vil_image_view<double>& k,
00053                            double ref_x, double ref_y)
00054 {
00055   // Copy, ensuring istep==1
00056   unsigned ni=k.ni(),nj=k.nj();
00057   kernel_.set_size(ni,nj);
00058   double sum=0.0,ss=0.0;
00059   for (unsigned j=0;j<nj;++j)
00060     for (unsigned i=0;i<ni;++i)
00061     {
00062       kernel_(i,j)=k(i,j);
00063       sum+=k(i,j); ss+=k(i,j)*k(i,j);
00064     }
00065 
00066   assert(!vnl_math_isnan(sum));
00067 
00068   // Normalise so that kernel_ has zero mean and unit sum of squares.
00069   double mean=sum/(ni*nj);
00070   ss-=(mean*mean*ni*nj);
00071   assert(ss>1e-6);  // If near zero, flat region - can't use correlation
00072   double s=1.0;
00073   if (ss>0) s = vcl_sqrt(1.0/ss);
00074   vil_math_scale_and_offset_values(kernel_,s,-s*mean);
00075 
00076   ref_x_ = ref_x;
00077   ref_y_ = ref_y;
00078 }
00079 
00080 //: Define filter kernel to search with
00081 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::set(const vil_image_view<double>& k)
00082 {
00083   set(k, 0.5*(k.ni()-1.0), 0.5*(k.nj()-1.0));
00084 }
00085 
00086 //: Define filter kernel to search with, expressed as a vector
00087 bool mfpf_norm_corr2d::set_model(const vcl_vector<double>& v)
00088 {
00089   // we assume that nplanes()==1
00090   unsigned ni=kernel_.ni(), nj=kernel_.nj();
00091   assert( v.size() == ni*nj );
00092 
00093   // copy vector values into im_k, column by column
00094   vil_image_view<double> im_k( kernel_.ni(), kernel_.nj() );
00095   unsigned vec_ind=0;
00096   for (unsigned j=0;j<nj;++j)
00097   {
00098     for (unsigned i=0;i<ni;++i,++vec_ind)
00099     {
00100       im_k(i,j)=v[vec_ind];
00101     }
00102   }
00103 
00104   // set kernel from created image
00105   set(im_k);
00106 
00107   return true;
00108 }
00109 
00110 //: Number of dimensions in the model
00111 unsigned mfpf_norm_corr2d::model_dim()
00112 {
00113   return kernel_.ni()*kernel_.nj();
00114 }

00116 //: Filter kernel to search with, expressed as a vector
00117 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::get_kernel_vector(vcl_vector<double>& v) const
00118 {
00119   // we assume that nplanes()==1
00120   unsigned ni=kernel_.ni(), nj=kernel_.nj();
00121   v.resize(ni*nj);
00122 
00123   // copy kernel values into v, column by column
00124   unsigned vec_ind=0;
00125   for (unsigned j=0;j<nj;++j)
00126   {
00127     for (unsigned i=0;i<ni;++i,++vec_ind)
00128     {
00129       v[vec_ind]=kernel_(i,j);
00130     }
00131   }
00132 }

00134 //: Relative size of region used for estimating overlap
00135 //  If 0.5, then overlap requires pt inside central 50% of region.
00136 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::set_overlap_f(double f)
00137 {
00138   overlap_f_=f;
00139 }
00140 
00141 // Assumes im2[i] has zero mean and unit length as a vector
00142 // Assumes element (i,j) is im1[i+j*jstep1] etc
00143 inline double norm_corr(const float* im1, const double* im2,
00144                         vcl_ptrdiff_t jstep1, vcl_ptrdiff_t jstep2,
00145                         unsigned ni, unsigned nj)
00146 {
00147   double sum1=0.0,sum2=0.0,sum_sq=0.0;
00148   for (unsigned j=0;j<nj;++j,im1+=jstep1,im2+=jstep2)
00149     for (unsigned i=0;i<ni;++i)
00150     {
00151       sum1+=im1[i]*im2[i];
00152       sum2+=im1[i];
00153       sum_sq+=im1[i]*im1[i];
00154     }
00155   unsigned n=ni*nj;
00156   double mean = sum2/n;
00157   double ss = vcl_max(1e-6,sum_sq-n*mean*mean);
00158   double s = vcl_sqrt(ss);
00159 
00160   return sum1/s;
00161 }
00162 
00163 static void normalize(vil_image_view<double>& im)
00164 {
00165   unsigned ni=im.ni(),nj=im.nj();
00166   double sum=0.0,ss=0.0;
00167   for (unsigned j=0;j<nj;++j)
00168     for (unsigned i=0;i<ni;++i)
00169     {
00170       sum+=im(i,j); ss+=im(i,j)*im(i,j);
00171     }
00172 
00173   assert(!vnl_math_isnan(sum));
00174 
00175   if (ss<1e-6)
00176   {
00177     vcl_cerr << "Warning: Almost flat region in mfpf_norm_corr2d_builder\n"
00178              << "         Size: "<<ni<<" x "<<nj<<vcl_endl;
00179   }
00180 
00181   // Normalise so that im has zero mean and unit sum of squares.
00182   double mean=sum/(ni*nj);
00183   ss-=(mean*mean*ni*nj);
00184   double s=1.0;
00185   if (ss>0) s = vcl_sqrt(1.0/ss);
00186   vil_math_scale_and_offset_values(im,s,-s*mean);
00187 }
00188 
00189 //: Get sample of region around specified point in image
00190 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::get_sample_vector(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00191                                          const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00192                                          const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00193                                          vcl_vector<double>& v)
00194 {
00195   assert(image.image().size()>0);
00196 
00197   vgl_vector_2d<double> u1=step_size_*u;
00198   vgl_vector_2d<double> v1(-u1.y(),u1.x());
00199 
00200   const vgl_point_2d<double> p0 = p-ref_x_*u1-ref_y_*v1;
00201 
00202   const vimt_transform_2d& s_w2i = image.world2im();
00203   vgl_point_2d<double> im_p0 = s_w2i(p0);
00204   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_u = s_w2i.delta(p0, u1);
00205   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_v = s_w2i.delta(p0, v1);
00206 
00207   vil_image_view<double> sample;
00208   vil_resample_bilin(image.image(),sample,
00209                      im_p0.x(),im_p0.y(),  im_u.x(),im_u.y(),
00210                      im_v.x(),im_v.y(),
00211                      kernel_.ni(),kernel_.nj());
00212   normalize( sample );
00213 
00214   v.resize( sample.ni()*sample.nj() );
00215   unsigned v_ind=0;
00216   for (unsigned j=0;j<sample.nj();j++)
00217   {
00218     for (unsigned i=0;i<sample.ni();i++,v_ind++)
00219     {
00220       v[v_ind] = sample(i,j);
00221     }
00222   }
00223 }
00224 
00225 //: Radius of circle containing modelled region
00226 double mfpf_norm_corr2d::radius() const
00227 {
00228   // Compute distance to each corner
00229   double wx = kernel_.ni()-1;
00230   double x2 = vcl_max(ref_x_*ref_x_,(ref_x_-wx)*(ref_x_-wx));
00231   double wy = kernel_.nj()-1;
00232   double y2 = vcl_max(ref_y_*ref_y_,(ref_y_-wy)*(ref_y_-wy));
00233   double r2 = x2+y2;
00234   if (r2<=1) return 1.0;
00235   return vcl_sqrt(r2);
00236 }
00237 
00238 //: Evaluate match at p, using u to define scale and orientation
00239 // Returns -1*edge strength at p along direction u
00240 double mfpf_norm_corr2d::evaluate(const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00241                                   const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00242                                   const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u)
00243 {
00244   vgl_vector_2d<double> u1=step_size_*u;
00245   vgl_vector_2d<double> v1(-u1.y(),u1.x());
00246 
00247   vil_image_view<float> sample;
00248 
00249   const vgl_point_2d<double> p0 = p-ref_x_*u1-ref_y_*v1;
00250 
00251   const vimt_transform_2d& s_w2i = image.world2im();
00252   vgl_point_2d<double> im_p0 = s_w2i(p0);
00253   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_u = s_w2i.delta(p0, u1);
00254   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_v = s_w2i.delta(p0, v1);
00255 
00256   vil_resample_bilin(image.image(),sample,
00257                      im_p0.x(),im_p0.y(),  im_u.x(),im_u.y(),
00258                      im_v.x(),im_v.y(),
00259                      kernel_.ni(),kernel_.nj());
00260 
00261   return 1.0-norm_corr(sample.top_left_ptr(),kernel_.top_left_ptr(),
00262                        sample.jstep(),kernel_.jstep(),
00263                        kernel_.ni(),kernel_.nj());
00264 }
00265 
00266 //: Evaluate match at in a region around p
00267 // Returns a quality of fit at a set of positions.
00268 // response image (whose size and transform is set inside the
00269 // function), indicates the points at which the function was
00270 // evaluated.  response(i,j) is the fit at the point
00271 // response.world2im().inverse()(i,j).  The world2im() transformation
00272 // may be affine.
00273 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::evaluate_region(
00274                         const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00275                         const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00276                         const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00277                         vimt_image_2d_of<double>& response)
00278 {
00279   assert(image.image().nplanes()==1);
00280   int ni=1+2*search_ni_;
00281   int nj=1+2*search_nj_;
00282   int nsi = 2*search_ni_ + kernel_.ni();
00283   int nsj = 2*search_nj_ + kernel_.nj();
00284 
00285   vil_image_view<float> sample;
00286   vgl_vector_2d<double> u1=step_size_*u;
00287   vgl_vector_2d<double> v1(-u1.y(),u1.x());
00288   const vgl_point_2d<double> p0 = p-(search_ni_+ref_x_)*u1
00289                                    -(search_nj_+ref_y_)*v1;
00290 
00291   const vimt_transform_2d& s_w2i = image.world2im();
00292   vgl_point_2d<double> im_p0 = s_w2i(p0);
00293   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_u = s_w2i.delta(p0, u1);
00294   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_v = s_w2i.delta(p0, v1);
00295 
00296   vil_resample_bilin(image.image(),sample,
00297                      im_p0.x(),im_p0.y(),  im_u.x(),im_u.y(),
00298                      im_v.x(),im_v.y(),
00299                      nsi,nsj);
00300 
00301   response.image().set_size(ni,nj);
00302   double* r = response.image().top_left_ptr();
00303   const double* k = kernel_.top_left_ptr();
00304   const float* s = sample.top_left_ptr();
00305   vcl_ptrdiff_t r_jstep = response.image().jstep();
00306   vcl_ptrdiff_t s_jstep = sample.jstep();
00307   vcl_ptrdiff_t k_jstep = kernel_.jstep();
00308 
00309   for (int j=0;j<nj;++j,r+=r_jstep,s+=s_jstep)
00310   {
00311     for (int i=0;i<ni;++i)
00312     {
00313       r[i] = 1.0-norm_corr(s+i,k,s_jstep,k_jstep,
00314                            kernel_.ni(),kernel_.nj());
00315     }
00316   }
00317 
00318   // Set up transformation parameters
00319 
00320   // Point (i,j) in dest corresponds to p1+i.u+j.v,
00321   // an affine transformation for image to world
00322   const vgl_point_2d<double> p1 = p-search_ni_*u1-search_nj_*v1;
00323 
00324   vimt_transform_2d i2w;
00325   i2w.set_similarity(vgl_point_2d<double>(u1.x(),u1.y()),p1);
00326   response.set_world2im(i2w.inverse());
00327 }
00328 
00329 //: Search given image around p, using u to define scale and angle
00330 //  On exit, new_p defines position of the best nearby match.
00331 //  Returns a quality of fit measure at that
00332 //  point (the smaller the better).
00333 double mfpf_norm_corr2d::search_one_pose(
00334                         const vimt_image_2d_of<float>& image,
00335                         const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00336                         const vgl_vector_2d<double>& u,
00337                         vgl_point_2d<double>& new_p)
00338 {
00339   int ni=1+2*search_ni_;
00340   int nj=1+2*search_nj_;
00341   int nsi = 2*search_ni_ + kernel_.ni();
00342   int nsj = 2*search_nj_ + kernel_.nj();
00343 
00344   vil_image_view<float> sample;
00345   vgl_vector_2d<double> u1=step_size_*u;
00346   vgl_vector_2d<double> v1(-u1.y(),u1.x());
00347   const vgl_point_2d<double> p0 = p-(search_ni_+ref_x_)*u1
00348                                    -(search_nj_+ref_y_)*v1;
00349 
00350   const vimt_transform_2d& s_w2i = image.world2im();
00351   vgl_point_2d<double> im_p0 = s_w2i(p0);
00352   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_u = s_w2i.delta(p0, u1);
00353   vgl_vector_2d<double> im_v = s_w2i.delta(p0, v1);
00354 
00355   vil_resample_bilin(image.image(),sample,
00356                      im_p0.x(),im_p0.y(),  im_u.x(),im_u.y(),
00357                      im_v.x(),im_v.y(),
00358                      nsi,nsj);
00359 
00360   const double* k = kernel_.top_left_ptr();
00361   const float* s = sample.top_left_ptr();
00362   vcl_ptrdiff_t s_jstep = sample.jstep();
00363   vcl_ptrdiff_t k_jstep = kernel_.jstep();
00364 
00365   double best_r=-9e99;
00366   int best_i=-1,best_j=-1;
00367   for (int j=0;j<nj;++j,s+=s_jstep)
00368   {
00369     for (int i=0;i<ni;++i)
00370     {
00371       double r = norm_corr(s+i,k,s_jstep,k_jstep,
00372                            kernel_.ni(),kernel_.nj());
00373       if (r>best_r) { best_r=r; best_i=i; best_j=j; }
00374     }
00375   }
00376 
00377   // Compute position of best point
00378   new_p = p+(best_i-search_ni_)*u1+(best_j-search_nj_)*v1;
00379   return 1.0 - best_r;
00380 }
00381 
00382 // Returns true if p is inside region at given pose
00383 bool mfpf_norm_corr2d::is_inside(const mfpf_pose& pose,
00384                                  const vgl_point_2d<double>& p,
00385                                  double f) const
00386 {
00387   // Set transform model frame -> World
00388   vimt_transform_2d t1;
00389   t1.set_similarity(step_size()*pose.u(),pose.p());
00390   // Compute position of p in model frame
00391   vgl_point_2d<double> q=t1.inverse()(p);
00392   q.x()/=f; q.y()/=f;  // To check that q in the central fraction f
00393   q.x()+=ref_x_;
00394   if (q.x()<0 || q.x()>(kernel_.ni()-1)) return false;
00395   q.y()+=ref_y_;
00396   if (q.y()<0 || q.y()>(kernel_.nj()-1)) return false;
00397   return true;
00398 }
00399 
00400 //: Return true if modelled regions at pose1 and pose2 overlap
00401 //  Checks if reference point of one is inside region of other
00402 bool mfpf_norm_corr2d::overlap(const mfpf_pose& pose1,
00403                                const mfpf_pose& pose2) const
00404 {
00405   if (is_inside(pose1,pose2.p(),overlap_f_)) return true;
00406   if (is_inside(pose2,pose1.p(),overlap_f_)) return true;
00407   return false;
00408 }
00409 
00410 //: Generate points in ref frame that represent boundary
00411 //  Points of a contour around the shape.
00412 //  Used for display purposes.
00413 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::get_outline(vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> >& pts) const
00414 {
00415   pts.resize(7);
00416   int roi_ni=kernel_.ni();
00417   int roi_nj=kernel_.nj();
00418   vgl_vector_2d<double> r(ref_x_,ref_y_);
00419   pts[0]=vgl_point_2d<double>(0,roi_nj)-r;
00420   pts[1]=vgl_point_2d<double>(0,0);
00421   pts[2]=vgl_point_2d<double>(roi_ni,roi_nj)-r;
00422   pts[3]=vgl_point_2d<double>(0,roi_nj)-r;
00423   pts[4]=vgl_point_2d<double>(0,0)-r;
00424   pts[5]=vgl_point_2d<double>(roi_ni,0)-r;
00425   pts[6]=vgl_point_2d<double>(roi_ni,roi_nj)-r;
00426 }
00427 
00428 //: Return an image of the kernel
00429 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::get_image_of_model(vimt_image_2d_of<vxl_byte>& image) const
00430 {
00431   vil_convert_stretch_range(kernel_,image.image());
00432   vimt_transform_2d ref2im;
00433   ref2im.set_zoom_only(1.0/step_size_,ref_x_,ref_y_);
00434   image.set_world2im(ref2im);
00435 }

00462 
00463 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::b_write(vsl_b_ostream& bfs) const
00464 {
00465   vsl_b_write(bfs,version_no());
00466   mfpf_point_finder::b_write(bfs);  // Save base class
00467   vsl_b_write(bfs,kernel_);
00468   vsl_b_write(bfs,ref_x_);
00469   vsl_b_write(bfs,ref_y_);
00470   vsl_b_write(bfs,overlap_f_);
00471 }
00472 
00473 short mfpf_norm_corr2d::version_no() const
00474 {
00475   return 2;
00476 }
00477 
00478 //=======================================================================
00479 // Method: load
00480 //=======================================================================
00481 
00482 void mfpf_norm_corr2d::b_read(vsl_b_istream& bfs)
00483 {
00484   if (!bfs) return;
00485   short version;
00486   vsl_b_read(bfs,version);
00487   switch (version)
00488   {
00489     case (1):
00490     case (2):
00491       mfpf_point_finder::b_read(bfs);  // Load in base class
00492       vsl_b_read(bfs,kernel_);
00493       vsl_b_read(bfs,ref_x_);
00494       vsl_b_read(bfs,ref_y_);
00495       if (version==1) overlap_f_=1.0;
00496       else            vsl_b_read(bfs,overlap_f_);
00497       break;
00498     default:
00499       vcl_cerr << "I/O ERROR: vsl_b_read(vsl_b_istream&)\n"
00500                << "           Unknown version number "<< version << vcl_endl;
00501       bfs.is().clear(vcl_ios::badbit); // Set an unrecoverable IO error on stream
00502       return;
00503   }
00504 }
00505 
00506 //: Test equality
00507 bool mfpf_norm_corr2d::operator==(const mfpf_norm_corr2d& nc) const
00508 {
00509   if (!base_equality(nc)) return false;
00510   if (kernel_.ni()!=nc.kernel_.ni()) return false;
00511   if (kernel_.nj()!=nc.kernel_.nj()) return false;
00512   if (vcl_fabs(ref_x_-nc.ref_x_)>1e-6) return false;
00513   if (vcl_fabs(ref_y_-nc.ref_y_)>1e-6) return false;
00514   if (kernel_.size()!=nc.kernel_.size()) return false;
00515   if (kernel_.size()==0) return true;  // ssd fails on empty
00516   return (vil_math_ssd(kernel_,nc.kernel_,double(0))<1e-4);
00517 }
